content.question: Which of the following is the particular solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the square root of x to the ninth power, plus 1, end root " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="y of 1, equals 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, two thirds times, open parenthesis, x to the ninth power plus 1, close parenthesis, raised to the three halves power, plus seven thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator 27 times x to the eighth power, end fraction, close parenthesis, times, open parenthesis, x to the ninth power plus 1, close parenthesis, raised to the three halves power, plus the fraction with numerator 81 minus 4 times the square root of 2, and denominator 27" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>27</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>81</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>27</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 3 plus the integral from 0 to x, of, the square root of t to the ninth power plus 1, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 3 plus the integral from 1 to x, of, the square root of t to the ninth power plus 1, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, 3 plus the integral from 1 to x, of, the square root of t to the ninth power plus 1, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
